column1: This type of infection is a common cause of ulcers.
Avoid drugs such as aspirin, ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin), or naproxen (Aleve, Naprosyn).
Take acetaminophen (Tylenol) to relieve pain.
The standard treatment for a peptic ulcer and an H. pylori infection uses a combination of medicines that you take for 5 to 14 days.
- These medicines may cause nausea, diarrhea, and other side effects.
If you have an ulcer without an H. pylori infection, or one that is caused by taking aspirin or NSAIDs, you will likely need to take a proton pump inhibitor for 8 weeks.
Talk to your provider about your medicine choices if your ulcer was caused by aspirin, ibuprofen, or other NSAIDs.
Or, your provider may have you take a drug called misoprostol or a PPI to prevent future ulcers.
